original: Lindh, Torsten August Victor, överstelöjtnant, Visby, f. 24/3/90 i Kristianstad av bankkass. August L. o. Anna Dahlgren. G. 1. 15 m. Karin Frost; 2. 40 m. Ingrid Broander. Barn: Margit f. 16, Lennart 17, Nils 25, Inga-Britta 26, Carl-Gustaf 29, Anna 42, Jacques 45. — Genomg. inf iskjutsk., ridsk., KHS, ital. krigshögsk., fransk skjutsk. samt fransk luftskjutsk., tjg. i arméerna i Frankr. 21-22, Algeriet 22, Ital. 23-25 o. 27, Danm. 29 o. Engl. 38, därjämte i offentl. uppdrag vist. i Norge, Estl. o. Tyskl. Undilöjtn. v. Skånska husarreg. 12, ryttmäst. 27, major i armén 37, v. Gotl. inf :reg. s. å., övilöjtn. 44. Andre lär. v. inf :-skjutsk. 22-23’, repetitör i -taktik v. KHS 30-34, vik. lär. i franska där 33 o. 34, led. av o. chef. f. försök m. cykel-, bil- o. pansarbiltrupp v. kav. 28, 29, 30 o. 31, reg :kvartermäst. v. Skånska husarreg. 25-27, ryttarskvadrons-chef 28-30, detaljchef v. gen:stabens utr:avd. 30-34, pansarbilskvadronschef 34-37, batrchef v. Gotl. inf:reg. 37-40, inskrivn xhef f. Gotl. inskrivn :omr. sed. 42. Skr.’: ett stort antal upps. m. m. i mil. tidskr. samt i dagspressen. Verkat ss. föredragshåll. RSO, OffTunNI, RDDO, RFinlVROlkl, RNSitOOlkl, OffFrdelTp, PrRKM3kl, SkytteM.
translated: Lindh, Torsten August Victor, Lieutenant Colonel, Visby, b. 24/3/90 in Kristianstad to bank cashier August L. and Anna Dahlgren. M. 1. 15 years with Karin Frost; 2. 40 years with Ingrid Broander. Children: Margit b. 16, Lennart b. 17, Nils b. 25, Inga-Britta b. 26, Carl-Gustaf b. 29, Anna b. 42, Jacques b. 45. Completed infantry, cavalry, KHS, Italian war academy, French shooting academy, and French aviation academy. Served in the armies of France from 1921-1922, Algeria 1922, Italy 1923-1925 and 1927, Denmark 1929 and England 1938. Additionally served in public positions in Norway, Estonia, and Germany. Second lieutenant in the Skånska hussar regiment in 1912, captain in 1927, major in the army in 1937, lieutenant colonel in the Gotland infantry regiment the same year, and major in 1944. Second teacher at the infantry shooting academy from 1922-1923, repeater in tactics at KHS from 1930-1934, acting teacher in French there in 1933 and 1934, member of and chief for experiments with bicycle, car, and armored car troops in the cavalry in 1928, 1929, 1930, and 1931, regimental quartermaster at the Skånska hussar regiment from 1925-1927, cavalry squadron commander from 1928-1930, chief of detail in the general staff's intelligence department from 1930-1934, armored car squadron commander from 1934-1937, battalion commander at the Gotland infantry regiment from 1937-1940, registration chief for the Gotland registration area since 1942. Written numerous articles and more in military magazines as well as in the daily press. Also worked as a lecturer. Awarded RSO, OffTunNI, RDDO, RFinlVROlkl, RNSitOOlkl, OffFrdelTp, PrRKM3kl, SkytteM.
